I’m saddened to learn of the passing of my friend and former Statehouse colleague, Jack Cera. During our time together in the Ohio Legislature, I came to know Jack as a dedicated public servant who worked tirelessly on behalf of the people of Eastern Ohio. 

He was thoughtful, steady, and always willing to reach across the aisle in pursuit of commonsense solutions for the Appalachian region. 

My deepest condolences go out to Jack’s family, friends, and the many people whose lives he touched through his years of service. He will be missed dearly.

Today, the House delivered a major win for the American people by passing the One Big Beautiful Bill and sending it to the president’s desk. 

This legislation protects Ohio families from crushing tax hikes, unleashes American energy, secures our border with historic investments, and strengthens vital programs like Medicaid and SNAP for those who need them most. 

Thanks to President Trump’s leadership, we’re standing up for hardworking Americans and eliminating taxpayer-funded waste, fraud, and abuse. 

I applaud my House and Senate colleagues for getting the One Big Beautiful Bill across the finish line and look forward to continuing our work to advance America First policies. 🇺🇸

Today, I proudly voted to pass the One, Big Beautiful Bill, which delivers on President Trump’s agenda to put American families first and set our nation on a path to prosperity. 

This legislation protects Ohioans from the largest tax hike in U.S. history, safeguards Medicaid for the most vulnerable in our communities, and unleashes the full potential of American energy. 

House Republicans are united in our commitment to cutting government waste, investing in our nation’s future, and ensuring that Americans keep more of their hard-earned paychecks. 

I urge the Senate to act swiftly so we can send this bill to the president’s desk.
